intro: Cerbera borbonica, commonly known as the Madagascar apple or wild apple, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often red or orange when ripe, containing several seeds. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
